intro: Luisia occidentalis, commonly known as the western luisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or reddish in color. Luisia occidentalis is characterized by its slender stems and heart-shaped leaves, making it a distinctive member of its genus.
